summary.p: The manuscript is in two parts, by two different hands. The first part contains Udayana’s Nyāyakusumāñjali, an 11th-century philosophical text attempting to prove the existence of God (īśvara) on logical grounds. The second contains Rāmabhadra Sārvabhauma’s commentary on Udayana's stanzas (up to 5.1), edited by Narendra Chandra Vedāntatīrtha (Calcutta, 1944) under the title Kusumāñjalikārikāvyākhyā. The introduction to Vedāntatīrtha's edition provides essential data about Rāmabhadra, a Bengali Navya-Naiyāyika active in the end of the 16th century or (more probably) in the beginning of the 17th. The son of Janakīnātha Cūḍāmaṇi, Rāmabhadra was a contemporary of Mathurānātha Tarkavāgīśa and the teacher of Jagadīśa and Jayarāma Nyāyapañcānana. In the introductory verses to his commentary, Rāmabhadra mentions earlier commentaries on Udayana's Kusumāñjali: Rucidatta’s Makaranda, Vardhamāna’s Prakāśa, one more commentary named Parimala, and one by his own father.

The manuscript probably corresponds to no. 122 in the list established by Pons in 1733 (= Omont 1902, p. 1183): ‘Koussoumanzali de Oudacanassarjia, de l’existence et de la nature de Dieu centre les Bodhistes’; it is listed under no. L (121) in Hamilton and Langlès (1807, p. 66) : ‘Kousou Mandjali (le bouquet de fleurs), traité sur la philosophie Nyâyâ (sic), par le même Oudayana.’ Cabaton (1907, p. 145) counts 350 pages (complete bundle), but gives only the title ‘Kusumāñjali, par Udayanācārya’. None of the existing catalogues identifies the commentary in the second part of the manuscript as Rāmabhadra’s.

msItem.title: Nyāyakusumāñjali
msItem.author: Udayana
msItem.incipit: oṃ namo bhagavate vāsudevāya || satpakṣaprasaraḥ satāṃ parimalaprodvodhavargotsavo vimlāno na vimardane mṛtarasaprasyandam ādhvīkabhūḥ | īśasyaiṣa niveśitaḥ padayage (sic) bhṛṅgāyamāṇaṃ bhramac ceto me ramayatv avighnam anagha nyāyaprasūnāñjaliḥ || śvargāpavargayor mārgam āmananti manīṣiṇaḥ | yad upāstim asāv atra paramātmā nirūpyate || iha yady api yaṃ kam api puruṣārtham athayamānāḥ śuddhabuddhasvabhāva ity aupaniṣadāḥ ādividvān siddha iti kapilāḥ || kleśakarmavipākāśayair aparāmṛṣṭo nirmāṇakāyam adhiṣṭhāya saṃpradāyapradyotako anugrāhakaś ceti pātañjalāḥ
msItem.explicit: nāpnuvāma śataśo yāmyāḥ punar jātanāḥ | iteṣa nītikusumāñjalir ujvalaśrīr yad vāsayed api ca dakṣiṇavāmakau dvau | no vā tataḥ kim amareśaguror gurus tu prīto stv anena padapīṭhasamarpite || arikarikumbhoddharasiṃhanādasya gautamamatanyāyarudrākarasya paṇḍitaśrīmadudayanasya nyāyakusumāñjalināmadheyaprakaraṇam idaṃ samāptaṃ || ° || ° || ° ||
msItem.finalRubric: arikarikumbhoddharasiṃhanādasya gautamamatanyāyarudrākarasya paṇḍitaśrīmadudayanasya nyāyakusumāñjalināmadheyaprakaraṇam idaṃ samāptaṃ || ° || ° || ° ||

msItem.title: Kusumāñjalikārikāvyākhyā
msItem.author: Rāmabhadra Sārvabhauma
msItem.incipit: oṃ nano gaṇeśāya || āmodaiḥ paritoṣitāḥ pariṣadaḥ pratyekam āśābhṛtāṃ sāndraiḥ piñjaritāḥ parāgapaṭalair āśāvakāśā daśa | āhūtā makarandavindunikaraiḥ puṣpandhayaḥ śreṇayo ye vāhnāya sa vaḥ punātu naṭataḥ śambhoḥ prasūnāñjaliḥ | satpakṣaprasaraḥ satāṃ api [corrected: satāṃ pa]rimalaprodbodhavaddhotsavo vimlāno na vimardane 'mṛtarasaprasyandamādhvīkṛtaḥ | īśasyaiṣa niveśitaḥ padayuge bhṛṅgāyamāṇaṃ bhramac ceto me ramayatv avighnam anagha nyāyaprasūnāñjaliḥ || bhavānībhavanāthābhyāṃ pitṛbhyāṃ praṇamāmy ahaṃ | yatprasādād idaṃ sarvvaṃ karakṣīropamīkṛtaṃ | makarande prakāśe yā vyākhyā parimale ’tha vā | tato ’dhikāṃ pitur vyākhyām ākhyātum ayam udyamaḥ || satpakṣeti eṣa mamānagha nyāyaprasūnāñjaliḥ satāṃ mumukṣūṇāṃ sudhiyāṃ vā ceto ramayatu sukhaya duḥkhanidānahīnam ākarotu anagho nirdoṣaḥ
msItem.explicit: āsipadagrāhyasaṃharaṇe | eṣa sarvāni bhūtāni samabhivyāpya vṛtitaḥ | janmāvṛddhikṣayair nityaṃ saṃbhrameyati cakravat | sarvabhūtāni kau prakṛtiṃ yānti māmakīṃ | kalpakṣaye punas tāni kalpādau visṛjāmy ahaṃ | vyavahāre ca pitāmahasya jagato mātā dhātā pitāmahaḥ | tathā yadi hy ahaṃ na vartteyaṃ jātu karmaṇy atandritaḥ | mama varmepanu varttanta manuṣyāḥ pārtha sarvaśaḥ utsīdeyur imo lokā na ku karma ced ahaṃ ||

extent.measure: 1 title page, first part (f. 1-113), second part (f. 1-66, with 51 missing). Part 1: 370 x 65 mm, part 2: 410 x 70 mm, according to Cabaton.

collation.desc: One title page, then continuous numeration from 1 to 113, Bengali numbers, middle right margin on the verso. Folio numbers are preceded by the invocation 'śrī'.
Continuous numeration from 1 to 66, f. 51 missing; f. 54 wrongly bound.

additions.p: Title given on the title page: Kusumāñjali (first hand).

origin.origDate: No internal date. This is part of a group of manuscripts sent to the Bibliothèque du Roi in Paris by Jesuits from Chandernagor between 1729 and 1735; already listed by J-F. Pons in 1733 (Omont 1902: 1179sq.). Cabaton (1907, p. 145) dates the ms. from the 17th c., but it is more likely that the copy was produced by a local scribe on Pons’ order, in Bengal, between 1727 and 1733.
